meanings.definition: A form of camouflage in which an animal's coloration is darker on the upper side and lighter on the underside.
meanings.sent1: The bird's countershading helped it blend into the shadows of the trees.
meanings.sent2: The fish's countershading made it hard to spot from above or below in the water.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon tried to use countershading by painting its back black and its belly white.
meanings.sent4: The artist used countershading in the painting to create a sense of depth and realism.
meanings.sent5: The concept of countershading is like wearing a dark hat to hide from the sun and a light shirt to hide in the snow.

meanings.definition: The act of applying this type of coloration to an object or animal for concealment.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper carefully studied countershading techniques to help protect the animals from predators.
meanings.sent2: The military used countershading on their vehicles to make them harder to see in different terrains.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy spy accidentally spilled paint while attempting countershading on the secret documents.
meanings.sent4: The magician used countershading on his props to make them seem to disappear into thin air.
meanings.sent5: The idea of countershading is like putting on a cloak of invisibility to hide in plain sight.
